Mr. President, we can address this together. Two years ago, I went to the White House to ask you to endorse my bill to let the government negotiate directly for lower drug prices.
Just yesterday, I held a hearing on the skyrocketing prices of prescription drugs and the financial hardships that families across the nation, and in Baltimore, are facing.

Mr. President, I go home to my district daily. Each morning, I wake up, and I go and fight for my neighbors.

It is my constitutional duty to conduct oversight of the Executive Branch. But, it is my moral duty to fight for my constituents.

Today, I’m chairing an Oversight Committee hearing examining the devastating impacts of drug companies’ price increases on the financial well-being and health of Americans.

Tune in live at 9:30 AM: https://www.youtube.com/user/OversightDems/featured …

Drug companies continue to raise their prices, rake in record profits, and lavishly reward their executives and shareholders, while stifling competition and preventing access to the life-saving drugs Americans need. This is unacceptable.

Earlier this month, I held a hearing with trauma survivors, public health experts, & government officials about childhood trauma.
 
We heard about some promising state & local programs that can identify, prevent, & treat childhood trauma. https://oversight.house.gov/news/press-releases/committee-examined-identifying-preventing-and-treating-childhood-trauma-with …

Congress must seek a comprehensive federal approach that recognizes the severe impact of childhood trauma & prioritizes prevention & treatment. 

We must act now, for the sake of our children & the generations yet unborn.

Childhood trauma is a pervasive public health issue that has long-term negative health effects on children.

I am glad to see Baltimore City recognizing the severity of the problem. https://www.baltimoresun.com/opinion/op-ed/bs-ed-op-0722-trauma-act-20190722-ayl64qnotrhvpkidtojjur43xa-story.html …

Americans—and the entire world—deserve better than this.

We must be so much better than this.
